intro: Eschscholzia minutiflora subsp. minutiflora, commonly known as the dwarf California poppy, is a member of the Papaveraceae family and is native to the western United States. It is a herbaceous annual plant with delicate, bright orange to yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of less than 10 centimeters, featuring slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are characterized by their five petals and are often found in clusters at the ends of the stems. This subspecies is adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland grasslands.
